subject: Investing
title: Neighborhood-Level Due Diligence
description: A quick, practical guide to Neighborhood-Level Due Diligence.

hook.text: An investor bought in a 'great city' but on the wrong block. The property lost value while neighbors gained.

buildup.text: Neighborhoods within the same city can have wildly different crime rates, schools, and demand.

discovery.text: Walk the streets, talk to local agents, check permits filed, and study rezoning applications.

twist.text: A street lined with renovation permits may signal coming gentrification and rising values.

climax.text: Micro-location research separates the winners from the surprises in any city.

punchline.text: The best deal in a bad block is still a bad deal.

quiz.question: Why is neighborhood-level research important?
options: Blocks within a city can vary dramatically
